Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Async components are only evaluated one time" (#1749) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.7.0

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/genu/vue-router-bug](https://github.com/genu/vue-router-bug)

### Steps to reproduce
Using the attached repo

1. Open Console
2. Click "Foo"
3. Console reads "Async loading component" and we see "Hello Foo"
4. Click "Bar"
5. We still still see "Hello Foo", but not console output

The steps can be reproduced by clicking "Bar" first with similar results

### What is expected?
I should see "Hello Bar" and another console output reading "Async loading component"

### What is actually happening?
The first async component that gets loaded gets loaded all the time for that route going forward. 

The component function is only called one time

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Trailing slash removed from route" (#1753) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.7.0

### Reproduction link
[https://gist.github.com/sagarkbhatt/cd3555ef6cdc767e7f579c35b697ae20](https://gist.github.com/sagarkbhatt/cd3555ef6cdc767e7f579c35b697ae20)

### Steps to reproduce
I have provided demo route config to replicate similar issue.

### What is expected?
App's server is configured such that it adds trailing slash to all URL. One of the functionality ( third party ) fetches content based on URL. Now problem is that it understand below URL as different URL.

e.g /foo and /foo/

### What is actually happening?
I defined my vue route which contains trailing slash at the end but router-link produces route without trailing slash. Can we produce the same route as defined in router config?
